summary: Syntax highlight colors change gradually based on minutes of hour
name: Changing-color-script
description:
Tested and works well with Java, Javascript, HTML, CSS, PHP, ActionScript (with 'actionscript.vim', available elsewhere in Vim.org), AutoIt and AutoHotKey.  Gradually changes changing syntax colours over the hour.

Benefits:
+ reduces user 'freezing' symptoms
+ improves space/time-awareness
+ recruits right side of brain brain cells

Disadvantages:
- Under Windows GUI resources are wasted over time due to how VIM changes colors
- Off-putting flicker occurs when color changes

Only affects GVIM. Nothing happens in VIM.
install_details: Open changingColor.vba in VIM, and type :so % and press RETURN.  Re-start VIM.  Chaging color will start working.  Remove it: simply type :RmVimball changingColor.vba and press RETURN.

versions.release_notes: Made Changing Color Script install as a VimBall, to save you copying and pasting lines into your _vimrc.  See install instructions.
